sensors.widgets

Class AlcoholThermometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sensors.widgets.AlcoholThermometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SensorWidget

    public class AlcoholThermometer
extends java.lang.Object
implements SensorWidget
    A typical red alcohol style outdoor window thermometer. It contains a Temperature instance to actually store values, and implements the SensorWidget in order to graphically display the information.
    See Also:
    Thermometer, SensorWidget, PGraphics

        public AlcoholThermometer(processing.core.PApplet applet)
        Class Constructor
        Parameters:
        applet - The parent class of all Processing "sketches" Using the Processing library outside of it's IDE requires that we pass the main Applet widow reference to "draw" on.

                  java.lang.String scale)
        Class Constructor
        Parameters:
        applet - The parent Processing Applet class to "draw" on
        scale - "C" Celsius or "F" Fahrenheit

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()

      • draw

        public void draw(int px0,
        int py0)
        The implementation of the SensorWidget's draw function. This is where we actually draw the widget. This is called continually from the Processing Thread, so we need to remember everything redrawn all the time. We use a PGraphics to draw on. That way we don't need to refer to the main PApplet class until we're done.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface SensorWidget
        Parameters:
        px0 - Distance from the left of the Processing canvas to draw widget
        py0 - Distance from the top of the Processing canvas to draw widget

      • isMouseOver

        public boolean isMouseOver()
        mouse is over our widget
        Specified by:
        isMouseOver in interface SensorWidget
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating if the mouse is over the widget. The isOver variable can be set with a simple test using the draw() coordinates: 
         if (applet.mouseX > x && applet.mouseX < x + widgetWidth && 
                 applet.mouseY > y && applet.mouseY < y  widgetHeight) {
    isOver = true;
}
